de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    a Rule object consists of an antecedent and a consequent; both antecedent and consequent are represented as a sequence of tuples, interpreted conjunctively; internally, we use integers to represent the literals: for URIs, blank nodes, and XSD atoms, we use positive ints (incl. 0), whereas variables are assigned negative numbers
    Since:
    JDK 1.5
    See Also:
    RuleStore

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Function> actions
      an internal representation of the functions occuring in the @action section of a rule
      protected int[][] ante
      the internal representation of the antecedent of a rule
      protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> blankNodeVariables
      free RHS-only variables that will introduce fresh new individuals (viz., blank nodes); a first occurence introduce the individual, further RHS mentionings (inside the same rule) refer to the same newly introduced individual
      protected Cluster[] clusters
      an array of clusters, encoding which LHS clauses will go together, as well as which in-eqs are applicable; clusters furthermore wrap the binding table(s) which originate from joining the local clauses belonging to a cluster
      protected int[][] cons
      the internal representation of the consequent of a rule
      protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> dontCareVariables
      LHS variables that will only occur once are refered to as don't cares; no binding during the matching phase is needed
      protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> inEqConstraints
      a list of Integer objects, either representing variables (< 0) or URIs/XSD atoms (> 0); Integers at odd positions always represent variables; the list is of even length, so that the (1st, 2nd), (3rd, 4th), etc.
      protected boolean isApplicable
      during the local matching phase, we partially detect (as a consequence of local matching) whether rules are applicable w.r.t.
      protected int[][] keys
      an array of int arrays (elements are called key) that is used to share local query bindings across structurally-equivalent clauses, even across rules
      protected Table[] localQueryBindings
      an array of "local" binding tables for each clause of the antecedent of the rule
      protected Cluster megaCluster
      a cluster encoding _the_ LHS binding table, originating from taking the Cartesian Product of the set of all independent LHS clusters
      protected java.lang.String name
      the name of a rule, mainly used for debugging purposes
      protected java.util.Set<int[]> output
      contains the set of all tuples that are generated within an iteration by this rule
      protected int priority
      a smaller value indicates that a rule is more important than rules with larger values; priorities will gain importannce during the parallel execution of rules to speed up processing; default value in case no priority is specified: Integer.MAX_VALUE NOTE: a priority value less or equal 0 switches off rule execution in the forward chainer
      protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> properVariables
      the set of ALL (local) rule variables
      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds
      represents a mapping from relational ids to their functional counterparts; note that relational variables in tests and actions might even be complex, leading to the array list in this data structure id(??var) -> [id(?var)] id(??(var1 ...
      protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> rhsVariables
      proper RHS-only variables (does NOT contain any blank node vars)
      protected RuleStore rstore
      a pointer to the rule store; useful to work with several rule systems at the same time
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Predicate> tests
      an internal representation of the predicates occuring in the @test section of a rule
      protected TupleStore tstore
      a pointer to the tuple store; useful to have for later decoding of int arguments

      returns the internal representation of the antecedent of a rule

      returns the ith clause of the antecedent of a rule; no checks are performed whether index i is valid

      returns the internal representation of the consequent of a rule

      returns the ith clause of the consequent of a rule; no checks are performed whether index i is valid

      returns a reference to _this_ RuleStore object
      TupleStore getTupleStore()
      returns a reference to the TupleStore object, used for decoding by the toString() method

      void setRuleStore(RuleStore rstore) 
      void setTupleStore(TupleStore tstore) 
      java.lang.String toString()
      to have a proper working toString() method, a rule must be associated with its tuple store to perform external decoding
      java.lang.String toString(TupleStore store)
      use this method if tuple store field has NOT been set for _this_ tuple NOTE: printer is incomplete as it misses general tests and actions

    • Field Detail

      • priority

        protected int priority
        a smaller value indicates that a rule is more important than rules with larger values; priorities will gain importannce during the parallel execution of rules to speed up processing; default value in case no priority is specified: Integer.MAX_VALUE NOTE: a priority value less or equal 0 switches off rule execution in the forward chainer
        See Also:
        ForwardChainer.noOfCores

      • name

        protected java.lang.String name
        the name of a rule, mainly used for debugging purposes

      • ante

        protected int[][] ante
        the internal representation of the antecedent of a rule

      • cons

        protected int[][] cons
        the internal representation of the consequent of a rule

      • properVariables

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> properVariables
        the set of ALL (local) rule variables

      • dontCareVariables

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> dontCareVariables
        LHS variables that will only occur once are refered to as don't cares; no binding during the matching phase is needed

      • rhsVariables

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> rhsVariables
        proper RHS-only variables (does NOT contain any blank node vars)

      • blankNodeVariables

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> blankNodeVariables
        free RHS-only variables that will introduce fresh new individuals (viz., blank nodes); a first occurence introduce the individual, further RHS mentionings (inside the same rule) refer to the same newly introduced individual

      • relIdToFunIds

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> relIdToFunIds
        represents a mapping from relational ids to their functional counterparts; note that relational variables in tests and actions might even be complex, leading to the array list in this data structure id(??var) -> [id(?var)] id(??(var1 ... varN)) -> [id(var1), ..., id(?varN)]

      • inEqConstraints

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> inEqConstraints
        a list of Integer objects, either representing variables (< 0) or URIs/XSD atoms (> 0); Integers at odd positions always represent variables; the list is of even length, so that the (1st, 2nd), (3rd, 4th), etc. objects stand in the inequality relation

      • tests

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Predicate> tests
        an internal representation of the predicates occuring in the @test section of a rule

      • actions

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Function> actions
        an internal representation of the functions occuring in the @action section of a rule

      • isApplicable

        protected boolean isApplicable
        during the local matching phase, we partially detect (as a consequence of local matching) whether rules are applicable w.r.t. the set of tuples

      • localQueryBindings

        protected Table[] localQueryBindings
        an array of "local" binding tables for each clause of the antecedent of the rule

      • keys

        protected int[][] keys
        an array of int arrays (elements are called key) that is used to share local query bindings across structurally-equivalent clauses, even across rules

      • clusters

        protected Cluster[] clusters
        an array of clusters, encoding which LHS clauses will go together, as well as which in-eqs are applicable; clusters furthermore wrap the binding table(s) which originate from joining the local clauses belonging to a cluster

      • megaCluster

        protected Cluster megaCluster
        a cluster encoding _the_ LHS binding table, originating from taking the Cartesian Product of the set of all independent LHS clusters

      • output

        protected java.util.Set<int[]> output
        contains the set of all tuples that are generated within an iteration by this rule

      • tstore

        protected TupleStore tstore
        a pointer to the tuple store; useful to have for later decoding of int arguments

      • rstore

        protected RuleStore rstore
        a pointer to the rule store; useful to work with several rule systems at the same time
